content: #socks_time by @floralwool this is not a detailed pattern this file contains directions and the chart so you can make socks with your favorite heel and toe parts size eu 36 40 adjust length and width by changing needle size or stitch count 1 @floralwool for personal use only #socks_time materials fingering weight / 4ply sock yarn approx 400 420 m per 100 g circular needles or dpns size 2 0 2 5 mm tapestry needle stitch markers gauge approx 32 sts = 10 cm in stockinette after blocking instructions 1 cast on 62 66 70 sts using long tail method join in the round being careful not to twist place a marker 2 cuff ribbing work 12 14 rounds of ribbing as shown in the first row of the chart 3 leg pattern repeat the charted pattern twice around each round continue for 3 5 full pattern repeats depending on your desired leg length for eu 36 with 2 0 mm needles 4 repeats = ankle-length sock 4 heel work the heel on half of the stitches 31 33 35 sts use your preferred method classic dutch heel french heel short-row heel resume working in the round across all stitches after heel is completed 5 foot continue in pattern or switch to stockinette under the foot if preferred until the foot measures approx 5 cm less than total foot length 2 @floralwool for personal use only #socks_time 6 toe work a toe of your choice classic wedge toe round toe anatomical toe etc decrease until 8 12 sts remain then graft with kitchener stitch finishing weave in all ends block gently if desired 3 @floralwool for personal use only #socks_time
